alert.note: Alert for Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 2:59AM PDT until March 16 at 11:42AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Red Bluff Diversion Dam, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sacramento River at Vina Woodson Bridge. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 184.9 feet, South Avenue starts to flood east of the river. At 185.9 feet, South Avenue is flooded and closed. The Woodson Bridge RV Park office and spaces 1-14, 34-52, and 62-72 start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 184.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 AM PDT Wednesday was 184.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 186.4 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 183.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 186.4 feet on 02/27/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM PDT.
